Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I have added the Bally Alley Astrocast podcast #6 today.

Episode 6 of the =
Bally Alley Astrocast covers The Incredible Wizard, the port of the arcade =
game Wizard of Wor.  Paul and I are joined by our new co-host Michael Di Sa=
lvo (yeah, Michael!).  Paul and I cover the Arcadian newsletter issues 7 an=
d 8 (June and July 1979).  Paul and I discuss six letters to the Arcadian, =
dating from the Spring and Summer of 1979.  There is plenty of feedback and=
 articles, plus Michael has a really cool segment with his son in which the=
y review The Incredible Wizard together (this is one of my favorite parts o=
f the episode).

The next Astrocast podcast (episode 7) will feature holida=
y feedback in the December episode.  If you have any holiday stories to sha=
re, then please send the feedback that you'd like to see included in episod=
e 7 by December 16'th.  I can't wait to hear your tales!

You can download =
Astrocast #6 here:

http://www.ballyalleyastrocast.libsyn.com/rss


This ep=
isode is about three hours and fifteen minutes long.  Remember that you don=
't have to listen to it all in one sitting (the pause button is meant to be=
 used at your discretion, as often as you like).


Special thanks to Chris =
for editing this podcast.  He took scattered segments, pieces, music, sound=
 effects and made them into a complete final episode that works great as a =
whole.  Without his expertise, this episode wouldn't be nearly as fun-- and=
 probably wouldn't exist at all.


Enjoy the podcast!


Adam

--_000_CY4PR1601MB1141477488EAB49970B069D0C8B40CY4PR1601MB1141_

<p>I have added the Ba=
lly Alley Astrocast podcast #6 today.</p>
<p></p>
<p>Episode 6 of the Bally=
 Alley Astrocast covers <em>The Incredible Wizard</em>, the port of the arc=
ade game
<em>Wizard of Wor</em>.  Paul and I are joined by our new co-=
host Michael Di Salvo (yeah, Michael!).  Paul and I cover the
<em>Arca=
dian</em> newsletter issues 7 and 8 (June and July 1979).  Paul and I =
discuss six letters to the Arcadian, dating from the Spring and Summer of 1=
979.  There is plenty of feedback and articles, plus Michael has a rea=
lly cool segment with his son in which
 they review <em>The Incredible Wiza=
rd</em> together (this is one of my favorite parts of the episode).</p>
<p>=
</p>
<p>The next Astrocast podcast (episode 7) will feature holiday feedbac=
k in the December episode.  If you have any holiday stories to share, =
then please send the feedback that you'd like to see included in episode 7 =
by December 16'th.  I can't wait to hear your
 tales!</p>
<p></p>
<p>Y=
ou can download Astrocast #6 here:</p>
<p></p>
<p><a class=3D"OWAAutoLink" =
id=3D"LPlnk208352" href=3D"http://www.ballyalleyastrocast.libsyn.com/rss" p=
reviewremoved=3D"true">http://www.ballyalleyastrocast.libsyn.com/rss</a></p=
>
<p><br>
</p>
<p>This episode is about three hours and fifteen minutes lon=
g.  Remember that you don't have to listen to it all in one sitting (t=
he pause button is meant to be used at your discretion, as often as you lik=
e).</p>
<p><br>
</p>
<p>Special thanks to Chris for editing this podcast.&n=
bsp; He took scattered segments, pieces, music, sound effects and made them=
 into a complete final episode that works great as a whole.  Without h=
is expertise, this episode wouldn't be nearly as fun-- and probably
 wouldn=
't exist at all.</p>
<p><br>
</p>
<p>Enjoy the podcast!</p>
<p><br>
</p>
<p=
>Adam</p>
